entry.title: Eating 🍲 Exploring 🚷 and Drawing 🖌️ Across 🐈 Istanbul 🌇

media:group.media:title: Eating 🍲 Exploring 🚷 and Drawing 🖌️ Across 🐈 Istanbul 🌇
media:group.media:description:
💥[Please support me on Patreon]💥 https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen Join me on a regular day across Istanbul; where I explore a dead mall (again), run into paranormal mischief, eat, pet cats, eat some more, explore the city's strange back-alleys, visit an antiques bazaar, and draw alien creatures for my upcoming world-building projects...
Special thanks to Jakub Bobrowicz for inspiring this episode, by recommending me to film my daily art practice.
More on http://www.cmkosemen.com

entry.title: 🐉✍🏼How to Be a Spec-Evo Author: Answering Fan Questions

media:group.media:title: 🐉✍🏼How to Be a Spec-Evo Author: Answering Fan Questions
media:group.media:description:
[[Please support me on Patreon]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen Please see http://www.cmkosemen.com/books.html for a complete list of my books. Answers to a list of questions from Belen Martinez - mostly about "making it" as a spec-evo-centred author and overall creative. The short answer: Is the creative endeavour really compatible with "making it" at all? I also describe my writing process in detail...
***
Questions 1. What do you consider are the requirements to become an author? 2. What are the advantages and disadvantages of being an author? 3. If you have competition, how do you deal with said competition? 4. What to do when inspiration is low? 5. Why do you think being an author/book writer is not being taken seriously? Especially those who write fantasy. 6. Why is the job of book writing important? 7. What is your writing process? 8. How does one go about publishing a book? 9. Your book Snaiad has many fascinating creatures, what are some things that helped you come up with them?

entry.title: 🐍 GLYCON: 🐍✨The True Story of Ancient Rome's Most Sordid Snake Cult✨

media:group.media:title: 🐍 GLYCON: 🐍✨The True Story of Ancient Rome's Most Sordid Snake Cult✨
media:group.media:description:
[[Please support me on Patreon]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen
📖 Lucian of Samosata's full account of the Glycon hustle - REQUIRED READING! 📖 https://www.tertullian.org/rpearse/lucian/lucian_alexander.htm
A comprehensive, illustrated talk about Glycon the Serpent God - a sordid cult created by a Roman-era hustler; showing how meticulously the forgery behind the cult was prepared; how functional narcissists still rule the world; how there is not much new under the sun; and a special place-name reveal that illustrates this cult's still-ongoing legacy. Recorded while I was overcome by seasonal flu... but the SHOW MUST GO ON!

entry.title: Day-Trip Train Odyssey to İzmit, Turkey 🚂🏛️🏺

media:group.media:title: Day-Trip Train Odyssey to İzmit, Turkey 🚂🏛️🏺
media:group.media:description:
[[Please support me on Patreon]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen Join me on a great daily train-trip to İzmit, Turkey; where I tour the local archaeology museum; present views from daily life and food; and hang out at a local cafe, drawing alien creatures a friend...
Please visit my friend Alp's IG page on https://www.instagram.com/pongo_tridactyla/ More on http://www.cmkosemen.com

media:group.media:title: Surprise Gumby Dinosaur Test Stream
media:group.media:description: This is a sudden, surprise stream where I hope to talk with you all about dinosaurs and other prehistoric life!

entry.title: CMTK Talk Hour Episode 7: Horror Movies and Horrible Histories 📽️🎃🎥🔪

media:group.media:title: CMTK Talk Hour Episode 7: Horror Movies and Horrible Histories 📽️🎃🎥🔪
media:group.media:description:
👽[Please support T.K. Sivgin]] https://www.patreon.com/manospondylus 🗿[Please support me]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen
In this spooky October episode (for real this time), we talk about horror movies we thought were of note; the horror films which scarred us for life; discuss which version of being undead is the best; and unexpectedly drift off into a protracted discussion of Turkic history.
CMTK PODCAST LINKS: Anchor: https://spotifyanchor-web.app.link/e/1Sok6N0f6tb RSS-Link: https://anchor.fm/s/bd737f7c/podcast/rss Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/1aOf59C1sdCm1NrrJTFlyU?si=qN1grA1pTOyfYh6hFtYrEQ Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/episode-7-horror-movies-and-horrible-histories/id1647995859?i=1000582574533 Overcast: https://overcast.fm/+8roBDNOBU

media:group.media:title: Realistic Screentone Palaeoart Tutorial 🔳 🔲
media:group.media:description:
[[Please support me on Patreon]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen Learn how to produce great palaeoart by using a very time-efficient, realistic screentone technique. Today we are drawing a portrait of Zhenyuanopterus, a snaggle-toothed, prehistoric flying reptile. Support me on Patreon to see the full-scale finished artwork!
My secret screen tone stash is on http://cmkosemen.com/screentones.html
Visit Halftone Hospital for great screentone brushes and realistic pen emulators: https://halftonehospital.com/

entry.title: The Otherworldly Djinn Figures of Minoan Crete: Interview with Leo Troiano

media:group.media:title: The Otherworldly Djinn Figures of Minoan Crete: Interview with Leo Troiano
media:group.media:description:
[[Please support me on Patreon]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen Please follow Leo on https://twitter.com/oTroianoleo Me and historian Leonardo Troiano talk about the enigmatic and inspiring djinn (or genius or genii) figures of Minoan create - and their historic background, their roots and evolution; among other things.
We want your Minoan Djinn fanart! Please visit www.cmkosemen.com/inspiration.html for a big collection of Minoan Djinn illustrations.
More on the Minoan djinns: 👹 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minoan_Genius 👹 http://kuscholarworks.ku.edu/dspace/bitstream/1808/4496/1/Rehak_Genius_CMS_B5.pdf 👹 https://www.academia.edu/1311877/The_Transformation_of_Egyptian_Taweret_into_the_Minoan_Genius

entry.title: Exploring Modern and Ancient Wonders in Ankara's Ulus District 🏺🪦🏚🗺

media:group.media:title: Exploring Modern and Ancient Wonders in Ankara's Ulus District 🏺🪦🏚🗺
media:group.media:description:
[[Please support me on Patreon]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen An amazing urban expedition where we compare the seedy, kaleidoscopic weirdness of Ankara's historic Ulus district with an archaeological site containing awe-inspiring, millennia-old, Roman and Hellenistic-era tombstones. Both the past and the present are equally interesting.
More on www.cmkosemen.com

entry.title: CMTK Talk Hour Episode 6: Ultimate Halloween Gamer Extravaganza 🎮🕹️👾

media:group.media:title: CMTK Talk Hour Episode 6: Ultimate Halloween Gamer Extravaganza 🎮🕹️👾
media:group.media:description: 👽[Please support T.K. Sivgin]] https://www.patreon.com/manospondylus 🗿[Please support me]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen In a BIG but mostly non-Halloween-related podcast, T. K. Sivgin and I continue our rambling discussion of the computer games that shaped our lives. Games discussed include El-Fish, Paraworld, Star Trek: The Next Generation – A Final Unity, the Oddworld Franchise, Tomb Raider, the Total War Series, Donkey Kong Country Returns, among many others - as well as the incredible power that is childhood imagination!

entry.title: 💠K🔹A🔹R🔹U🔹M💠 Exploring Ankara's Idle, Legacy 1990s Shopping Mall

media:group.media:title: 💠K🔹A🔹R🔹U🔹M💠 Exploring Ankara's Idle, Legacy 1990s Shopping Mall
media:group.media:description:
[[Please support me on Patreon]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen Join me on a short expedition of Karum, a once-glamorous shopping mall in Ankara, Turkey, which has now fallen into a strange, liminal, semi-idle status.
More on www.cmkosemen.com
1993 footage used with kind permission of Mr. Necip Köni: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wx6rCVI9ovc&t=4s

entry.title: CMTK Talk Hour Episode 5: Dinosaurs in Computer Games, Dream Games and Beyond... 🕹️

media:group.media:title: CMTK Talk Hour Episode 5: Dinosaurs in Computer Games, Dream Games and Beyond... 🕹️
media:group.media:description:
👽[Please support T.K. Sivgin]] https://www.patreon.com/manospondylus 🗿[Please support me]] https://www.patreon.com/cmkosemen
A great big rambling podcast in which we talk about our favourite computer games; cathartic childhood memories about nostalgic gaming moments; the strange, universal trend of thinking one's self as a dinosaur; our DREAM COMPUTER GAMES, and more...
T.K. Sivgin's Sim Earth review: https://www.manospondylus.com/2021/11/simearth-ultimate-god-game.html T. K. Sivgin's Carnivore (1998) review: https://www.manospondylus.com/2020/07/the-fascinating-afterlife-of-carnivores.html
